Wings Application
Wings Application–Apply Online At Wings Today
Wings Job Application Online
WINGS does not provide a printable job application form, so use the WINGS online job application form for employment via the company website.
Wings Jobs Available
Jobs available include Sales Associate, Cashier, Maintenance Technician, Stock Room Associate, Merchandise Handler, Keyholder, Assistant Store Manager, General Store Manager
Minimum Employment Age At Wings :
You must be at least 18 years old to work at Wings.
Wings Store Hours
Wings is open from 10am to 9pm Monday through Saturday, and from 11am to 8pm on Sunday.
Although the brief name implies a fast-food restaurant where you can order delicious fried chicken, WINGS is actually a retail location offering souvenirs such as shot glasses, hats, and sweatshirts.
The first WINGS location opened in 1978 with two brothers in business who bet they could make an impact on the world of souvenirs. They were right. The company has since expanded to over 30 locations in 6 states, with no indication of slowing. If you’d love to meet people who love to remember where they’ve been, fill out a WINGS online job application today for a job you certainly won’t forget.

Most Common Positions At Wings &Income Information
The most common entry-level positions at WINGS are the sales associate and the cashier. Experienced supervisors will find the most common position available to be the assistant store manager.
Cashiers are the people who work the cash register. Easy enough, right? Well, not exactly. Working a cash register means being dedicated to efficiency and great customer service. Every customer should be greeted with a smile and should leave the store with every intent of returning. Customers are the life blood of any store, and should be treated like they are. This means that a cashier is responsible for return and repeat business as well as the simple act of running a register and checking customers out of a store with a receipt in hand.
Sales associates need to understand what makes customers come to WINGS- the souvenirs and gifts. A good associate knows the location of all of the most popular items and knows just the thing to show unsure customers when they walk through the door. A good sales associate is hard-working, outgoing, and enthusiastic.
Assistant managers are the ringleaders who tie it all together. They’re responsible for making sure that each employee has adequate training, experience, and know-how to run the show themselves. They’ll also be the ones making the schedule and taking over for the sales associates when they need help, or when a customer requires a certain experience for their needs.
Typical entry-level employees at Wings make $7.25 an hour. Managers and assistant managers typically make a yearly wage, which varies with the managers’prior experience and the location of the store.
Wings Benefits
Qualified employees receive an employee discount, solid starting pay, paid time off, retirement plans, and sometimes even more. Turn in your WINGS job application form today and find out how you can score a job you’ll always remember.
